dt: {bc}given to expressing oneself freely or insistently {bc}{sx|outspoken||}
{bc}having or exercising the power of producing voice, speech, or sound
{bc}relating to, composed or arranged for, or sung by the human voice
{bc}of, relating to, or resembling the voice

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}vocalis{/it}, from {it}voc-, vox{/it} voice {ma}{mat|voice|}{/ma}
shortdef: produced in the larynx : uttered with voice
given to expressing oneself freely or insistently : outspoken

dt: {bc}a usually accompanied musical composition for the human voice {bc}{sx|song||}

shortdef: a usually accompanied musical composition for the human voice : song; also : a performance of such a composition

dt: {bc}either of two pairs of folds of mucous membranes that project into the cavity of the larynx and have free edges extending dorsoventrally toward the middle line

shortdef: either of two pairs of folds of mucous membranes that project into the cavity of the larynx and have free edges extending dorsoventrally toward the middle line

dt: {bc}the lower pair of vocal cords each of which when drawn taut, approximated to the contralateral member of the pair, and subjected to a flow of breath produces the voice

shortdef: the lower pair of vocal cords each of which when drawn taut, approximated to the contralateral member of the pair, and subjected to a flow of breath produces the voice
